one minute to talk about why distributed tracing and on why we think it's it's actually in need in the industry so
distributed tracing uh is a tool is really a transaction monitoring for
microservices and it's different from traditional monitoring tools we like
metrics and login in a sense that as architectures can evolve from a single threaded to like multi-threader to
asynchronous stay into microservices the monitoring of the transactions within
microservices has become very difficult because you now have to travel uh
through multiple threads through multiple processes boundaries in order to collect the information about one
single request go into the architecture and distribute the trace and solve that particular issue and allows you to both
monitor those things analysis on them and the way distributed
tracing works is on the principle of context propagation where in this example on the left where if we have a
request coming into your top level service in the architecture we associate a certain contexts with that request the
virtual content uh and uh for tracing purposes you can store unique Trace ID in that context but it could have other
data metadata as well and then as long as this context is propagated throughout
all the call graphs we can collect data about that request and that transaction and present a concise view uh like the
timeline view and all other ways of investigating and running down
